Module guigame
Package guigame.logic.main

Class MainGame

java.lang.Object
guigame.logic.main.MainGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyboardButtonAdapter
public class MainGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements KeyboardButtonAdapter
Logic part to GUIMainGame. Shows the GUIGameWindow and from here, the game is started (with GUI).

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • MainGame

      public MainGame​(int height, int width)
      Creates a new MainGame. It starts the main menu, from where a game (GameBoard) can be started.
      Parameters:
      height - Height of the window
      width - Width of the window

  • Method Details

    • showGameWindow

      private static void showGameWindow​(javax.swing.JFrame window, boolean b)
      Sets a JFrame to visible.
      Parameters:
      window - The JFrame
      b - Whether the JFrame should be set to visible or invisible

    • create

      private void create()
      Initializes the MainGame. Create the listeners. Create the GUIGameWindow. Show the main menu.

    • createMainMenu

      private void createMainMenu()
      Creates an MainMenu. Initializes the players.

    • createGameBoard

      private void createGameBoard​(boolean human)
      Creates a new GameBoard and sets it.
      Parameters:
      human - Whether there will be one human player or not

    • createGameWindow

      private void createGameWindow()
      Create a GUIGameWindow, then show it.
      See Also:
      GUIGameWindow

    • createStartGameEventListener

      private void createStartGameEventListener()
      Create a StartGameEventListener.
      See Also:

    • createKeyboardEventListener

      private void createKeyboardEventListener()
      Create a KeyboardPressedEventListener.
      See Also:
      KeyboardPressedEventListener

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Prints play to the console. Create game board with settings from Main Menu, then show the GameBoard (starts game) destroy the parent window since it is not used anymore.
      See Also:
      GameBoard

    • changeState

      public void changeState​(GameState newState)
      Changes the current MainGame's GameState.
      Parameters:
      newState - new game state for the game
      See Also:
      GameState

    • showMainMenu

      private void showMainMenu()
      Add the (PREVIOUSLY SET) main menu to window and set game state to MAIN_MENU.

    • showGameBoard

      private void showGameBoard()
      Hides the parent window. Shows a GUIGameBoardWindow and initializes playing. Disposes (destroys) the parent window.

    • getPlayers

      public Players getPlayers()
      Returns:
      The players playing against each other.
